metadata.name: New Capture Session Launched Via DXCap.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of "DXCap.EXE" with the "-c" flag, which allows a user to launch any arbitrary binary or windows package through DXCap itself. This can be abused to potentially bypass application whitelisting.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\dxcap.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('dxcap.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -c ')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of "DXCap.EXE" with the "-c" flag, which allows a user to launch any arbitrary binary or windows package through DXCap itself. This can be abused to potentially bypass application whitelisting.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate execution of dxcap.exe by legitimate user References: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/OtherMSBinaries/Dxcap/, https://twitter.com/harr0ey/status/992008180904419328
